bug.short_desc: pam_yubico upgrade also requires ykclient upgrade to 2.15

long_desc.thetext: Description of problem: Please refer to rhbz#1265220 New release of pam_yubico requires that ykclient to upgraded to 2.15 If not, you are locked out with the following error: adding faulty module: /usr/lib64/security/pam_yubico.so: 17 Time(s) unable to dlopen(/usr/lib64/security/pam_yubico.so): /usr/lib64/security/pam_yubico.so: undefined symbol: ykclient_set_proxy: 17 Time(s) Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): How reproducible: Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2. 3. Actual results: Expected results: Additional info:
*** Bug 1318120 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Now this issue also happens on F-23 (see bug 1318120 which was firstly reported against xscreensaver but it is found to be due to this issue).

Note that build.log actually says: pam_yubico.c:895:5: warning: implicit declaration of function 'ykclient_set_proxy' [-Wimplicit-function-declaration] ykclient_set_proxy (ykc, cfg->proxy); ^ e.g. https://kojipkgs.fedoraproject.org//packages/pam_yubico/2.21/1.fc24/data/logs/x86_64/build.log
ykclient-2.15-1.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-e325023378
ykclient-2.15-1.el6 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 6. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-312c11093d

ykclient-2.15-1.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-6faedf8dbc

pam_yubico-2.21-2.fc22, ykclient-2.15-1.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. Yeah, so, I reported problems with packaging months ago. I think it never got resolved.
